alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:11AM EST until January 12 at 5:40AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Massachusetts, including the following counties, Bristol, Norfolk, Plymouth and Worcester and Rhode Island, including the following counties, Bristol, Kent, Newport, Providence and Washington. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EST. * IMPACTS...In Providence, several roads are flooded including portions of Charles Street, Atwells Avenue, Valley Street, and the left two lanes of the Thurbers Avenue curve on I-95 northbound. Local media have reported some cars have been stranded which have required water rescues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 AM EST, Between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain fell overnight. - Flooding impacts will continue early this morning but the heaviest rainfall has ended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, New Bedford, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, Taunton, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Dartmouth, Cumberland, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, Bridgewater, North Kingstown, Newport and Bristol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Avoid flooded roads! Turn around and find an alternate route.
